Description: Body sherd of Laconian black-figured pottery kylix with handle root; interior glazed; outside, rays at lower break with four lines above; below handle zone four lines between broad bands; unslipped handle zone with horizontal handle palmette part-preserved; added red paint on lower band outside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bryn Mawr, the Art and Artifact Collections. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Marked on the exerior in faint pencil N25 (?). Adhesive label on the interior of the sherd with the number 169 on it.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.69)
